newsitem.title: USA: Sterling Healthcare files Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
newsitem.headline: Sterling Healthcare files Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

text.p: Sterling Healthcare Corp and 15 affiliates filed for Chapter 11 protection in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Wilmington, Del., according to court papers obtained on Friday.
The papers showed Sterling listed assets totalling $40.6 million and liabilities totalling $69.4 million. About $30 million of the liabilities were fixed, liquidated secured debt with one holder.
Sterling also listed a total of $1.6 million in fixed, liquidated unsecured debt.
The court papers showed at least 20 percent of the company's voting securities were held by Citicorp's Citibank N.A., Regional Financial Enterprises III, and Charles River Partnership V.
The papers did not reveal the reason for the company's filing for bankruptcy protection.
Sterling of Bellevue, Wash., is a holding company for the operation of psychiatric treatment facilities. Among the names used by its affiliations are Heritage, Samissa, and Koala.
Sterling is expected to ask the court for orders that will allow it to operate normally.
